storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive notifications about approval decisions to stay informed on schedule changes

testCases.title: Validate notification delivery on approval decision
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active in the system
Scheduler has valid email address configured in profile
Approver user account exists with approval permissions
NotificationService is running and operational
System time is synchronized for accurate timestamp tracking

steps.action: Log in to the system as a Scheduler user
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Fill in all required fields for schedule change request (date, time, reason, etc.) and submit the request
steps.expectedResult: Request is successfully submitted and confirmation message is displayed with request ID

steps.action: Note the current system timestamp and log out from Scheduler account
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is recorded and Scheduler is logged out successfully

steps.action: Log in to the system as an Approver user
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and can access pending requests

steps.action: Navigate to pending schedule change requests and locate the submitted request
steps.expectedResult: The submitted request is visible in the pending requests list with correct details

steps.action: Select the request and approve it by clicking the Approve button and adding approval comments
steps.expectedResult: Request status changes to Approved and approval is confirmed with timestamp

steps.action: Note the approval timestamp and wait for notification delivery
steps.expectedResult: System processes the approval decision

steps.action: Check the time difference between approval timestamp and current time (should be within 1 minute)
steps.expectedResult: Time elapsed is less than or equal to 60 seconds

steps.action: Log in to Scheduler's email account and check for notification email
steps.expectedResult: Notification email is received with subject indicating schedule change request approval

steps.action: Open the notification email and verify it contains request ID, request details, approval status, and approver comments
steps.expectedResult: Email contains all required information: request ID, date/time of change, approval status, approver name, and comments provided during approval

steps.action: Log in to the system as Scheduler and check system alerts/notifications panel
steps.expectedResult: System alert notification is displayed showing the approval decision

steps.action: Click on the system alert to view full notification details
steps.expectedResult: Notification displays complete request details including request ID, approval status, approver comments, and timestamp matching the email notification

postconditions: Notification is successfully delivered via both email and system alert
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Scheduler is informed of the approval decision
Request status remains as Approved in the system

testCases.title: Validate notification delivery on rejection decision
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active in the system
Scheduler has valid email address configured in profile
Approver user account exists with approval permissions
NotificationService is running and operational
System time is synchronized for accurate timestamp tracking

steps.action: Log in to the system as a Scheduler user
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request submission page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Fill in all required fields for schedule change request and submit the request
steps.expectedResult: Request is successfully submitted and confirmation message is displayed with request ID

steps.action: Note the current system timestamp and log out from Scheduler account
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is recorded and Scheduler is logged out successfully

steps.action: Log in to the system as an Approver user
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and can access pending requests

steps.action: Navigate to pending schedule change requests and locate the submitted request
steps.expectedResult: The submitted request is visible in the pending requests list

steps.action: Select the request and reject it by clicking the Reject button and adding rejection reason/comments
steps.expectedResult: Request status changes to Rejected and rejection is confirmed with timestamp

steps.action: Note the rejection timestamp and calculate time difference (should be within 1 minute for notification delivery)
steps.expectedResult: Rejection timestamp is recorded and system processes the decision

steps.action: Verify that notification delivery time is within 1 minute of rejection decision
steps.expectedResult: Time elapsed between rejection and notification trigger is less than or equal to 60 seconds

steps.action: Log in to Scheduler's email account and check for rejection notification email
steps.expectedResult: Notification email is received with subject indicating schedule change request rejection

steps.action: Open the notification email and verify content includes request ID, rejection status, and rejection comments
steps.expectedResult: Email accurately reflects rejection decision with complete details: request ID, rejection status, approver name, rejection reason/comments, and timestamp

steps.action: Log in to the system as Scheduler and check system alerts/notifications panel
steps.expectedResult: System alert notification is displayed showing the rejection decision

steps.action: Click on the system alert to view full notification details
steps.expectedResult: Notification displays complete rejection information matching the email content

steps.action: Navigate to notification logs or admin panel to verify delivery status
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery status is logged as 'Delivered' with successful delivery timestamp for both email and system alert

postconditions: Rejection notification is successfully delivered via both email and system alert
Notification delivery attempt and status are logged in the system
Scheduler is informed of the rejection decision with reasons
Request status remains as Rejected in the system

testCases.title: Validate notification history display
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is logged into the system
Multiple schedule change requests have been submitted by the scheduler
At least some requests have been approved or rejected generating notifications
Notification history feature is enabled and accessible
Historical notification data exists in the system database

steps.action: Log in to the system as a Scheduler user
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Locate and click on the Notifications or Notification History menu option in the scheduler's dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Navigation menu displays the Notification History option

steps.action: Click on Notification History to navigate to the notification history page
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page loads and displays a list view of notifications

steps.action: Verify that the page displays all past notifications received by the scheduler
steps.expectedResult: All historical notifications are listed in chronological order (most recent first)

steps.action: Check that each notification entry displays key information: notification date/time, request ID, notification type (approval/rejection), and status
steps.expectedResult: Each notification entry shows complete summary information including timestamp, request ID, decision type, and read/unread status

steps.action: Select and click on a specific notification from the history list
steps.expectedResult: Notification details page or modal opens displaying full notification content

steps.action: Verify the detailed notification view includes request details, decision type, approver name, comments, and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: All notification details are displayed accurately including request ID, schedule change details, approval/rejection status, approver information, comments, and decision timestamp

steps.action: Navigate back to notification history list and select a different notification
steps.expectedResult: Different notification details are displayed correctly

steps.action: Verify that notification history includes both approval and rejection notifications
steps.expectedResult: History list contains notifications for both approved and rejected requests with appropriate indicators

steps.action: Check if the notification history page has pagination or scroll functionality if many notifications exist
steps.expectedResult: Page handles multiple notifications appropriately with pagination controls or infinite scroll

steps.action: Verify that notification timestamps are accurate and match the actual decision times
steps.expectedResult: All timestamps displayed in notification history match the actual approval/rejection decision times recorded in the system

postconditions: Scheduler has successfully viewed notification history
All past notifications remain accessible in the system
Notification read status may be updated if applicable
No data is modified during the viewing process

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view the status and history of my schedule change requests to track progress and decisions

testCases.title: Validate accurate display of request statuses
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active in the system
Scheduler has submitted multiple schedule change requests with varying statuses (Pending, Approved, Rejected)
Request dashboard feature is accessible to scheduler users
Database contains accurate status information for all requests
User has valid authentication credentials

steps.action: Log in to the system as a Scheduler user with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to the main dashboard

steps.action: Locate and click on the Schedule Change Requests or My Requests menu option
steps.expectedResult: Navigation menu displays the Schedule Change Requests option clearly

steps.action: Click on Schedule Change Requests to navigate to the request dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Request dashboard page loads within 3 seconds displaying the list of submitted requests

steps.action: Verify that the dashboard displays a list of all schedule change requests submitted by the logged-in scheduler
steps.expectedResult: Complete list of scheduler's requests is displayed with no missing entries

steps.action: Check that each request entry displays key information: request ID, submission date, requested schedule change details, and current status
steps.expectedResult: Each request shows request ID, submission timestamp, schedule change summary, and status badge/indicator

steps.action: Identify a request with 'Pending' status and verify the status indicator is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: Pending status is clearly indicated with appropriate visual indicator (e.g., yellow badge, pending icon) and text label 'Pending'

steps.action: Identify a request with 'Approved' status and verify the status indicator is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: Approved status is clearly indicated with appropriate visual indicator (e.g., green badge, checkmark icon) and text label 'Approved'

steps.action: Identify a request with 'Rejected' status and verify the status indicator is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: Rejected status is clearly indicated with appropriate visual indicator (e.g., red badge, X icon) and text label 'Rejected'

steps.action: Cross-reference displayed statuses with actual request statuses in the system database or by checking approval history
steps.expectedResult: All displayed statuses match the actual current status of each request in the system with 100% accuracy

steps.action: Refresh the dashboard page and verify that statuses remain consistent
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads within 3 seconds and all request statuses are displayed consistently without changes

steps.action: Verify that the dashboard displays requests in a logical order (e.g., most recent first or grouped by status)
steps.expectedResult: Requests are organized in a user-friendly manner with clear sorting logic

postconditions: Scheduler has successfully viewed all request statuses
No data is modified during the viewing process
Dashboard remains accessible for future access
All request statuses remain accurate in the system

testCases.title: Validate detailed approval history display
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is logged into the system
At least one schedule change request has been submitted and processed (approved or rejected)
Request has approval history with decisions, timestamps, and comments
Scheduler has access to view detailed request history
Request dashboard is accessible

steps.action: Log in to the system as a Scheduler user
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the Schedule Change Requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Request dashboard loads displaying list of submitted requests

steps.action: Identify a request that has been processed (approved or rejected) from the list
steps.expectedResult: Processed request is visible with appropriate status indicator

steps.action: Click on the request or click on a 'View Details' or 'View History' button/link associated with the request
steps.expectedResult: Request detail page or history modal opens displaying detailed information

steps.action: Verify that the detailed view displays the approval history section
steps.expectedResult: Approval history section is clearly visible and labeled

steps.action: Check that the approval history shows the approval decision (Approved or Rejected)
steps.expectedResult: Decision type is clearly displayed with appropriate visual indicator and text

steps.action: Verify that the approval history displays the approver's name or user ID
steps.expectedResult: Approver information is shown accurately identifying who made the decision

steps.action: Check that the approval history includes the timestamp of when the decision was made
steps.expectedResult: Decision timestamp is displayed in a clear format (e.g., 'MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM AM/PM' or 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS')

steps.action: Verify that the timestamp shown matches the actual time the approval/rejection decision was made in the system
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is accurate and matches system records with no discrepancies

steps.action: Check that the approval history displays any comments or notes provided by the approver
steps.expectedResult: Approver comments are displayed in full with proper formatting and readability

steps.action: Verify that all comments are complete and match what the approver entered during the approval/rejection process
steps.expectedResult: Comments are accurate, complete, and match the approver's input with no truncation or data loss

steps.action: If the request has multiple approval stages or history entries, verify that all entries are displayed chronologically
steps.expectedResult: All approval history entries are shown in chronological order with clear separation between entries

steps.action: Select a different processed request and repeat the verification of approval history details
steps.expectedResult: Different request's approval history is displayed accurately with all required information

steps.action: Verify that the approval history is read-only and cannot be modified by the scheduler
steps.expectedResult: No edit controls are available and history information is displayed in read-only format

postconditions: Scheduler has successfully viewed detailed approval history
No data is modified during the viewing process
Approval history remains accurate and unchanged in the system
Request status and history remain accessible for future reference

testCases.title: Validate filtering and export functionality
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is logged into the system
Multiple schedule change requests exist with different statuses (Pending, Approved, Rejected)
Requests have been submitted on different dates to enable date filtering
Filter and export features are enabled and accessible
System has PDF generation capability configured

steps.action: Log in to the system as a Scheduler user
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the Schedule Change Requests dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Request dashboard loads displaying the complete list of submitted requests

steps.action: Locate the filter controls on the dashboard (typically at the top or side of the request list)
steps.expectedResult: Filter section is visible with options for filtering by status and date

steps.action: Click on the Status filter dropdown and select 'Approved' status
steps.expectedResult: Status filter dropdown opens showing available status options (All, Pending, Approved, Rejected)

steps.action: Apply the status filter by clicking Apply or confirming the selection
steps.expectedResult: Request list refreshes and displays only requests with 'Approved' status, hiding all other requests

steps.action: Verify that all displayed requests have 'Approved' status and no other status requests are shown
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list contains only approved requests with accurate count displayed

steps.action: Change the status filter to 'Rejected' and apply
steps.expectedResult: Request list updates to show only rejected requests

steps.action: Clear the status filter and locate the date filter controls
steps.expectedResult: All requests are displayed again and date filter options are visible (date range picker or from/to date fields)

steps.action: Select a date range by choosing a start date and end date that includes some but not all requests
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected successfully with visual confirmation of selected dates

steps.action: Apply the date filter
steps.expectedResult: Request list refreshes and displays only requests submitted within the selected date range

steps.action: Verify that all displayed requests have submission dates within the selected date range
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list shows only requests matching the date criteria with accurate results

steps.action: Apply both status filter (e.g., 'Approved') and date filter simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: Request list displays only requests that match both filter criteria (approved AND within date range)

steps.action: Verify that the combined filters work correctly and display accurate results
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list shows only requests matching all applied filter criteria

steps.action: Locate the Export button or Export option on the dashboard (typically near the filter controls or at the top of the list)
steps.expectedResult: Export button is visible and enabled

steps.action: Click on the Export button to initiate the export process
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog or confirmation appears, indicating PDF format and requesting confirmation

steps.action: Confirm the export action to generate the PDF report
steps.expectedResult: System processes the export request and generates PDF file (progress indicator may be shown)

steps.action: Wait for the PDF generation to complete and download the file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated successfully and download begins automatically or download link is provided

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully without errors

steps.action: Verify that the PDF report contains the filtered request history data matching what was displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: PDF report includes all requests from the filtered list with complete details: request ID, submission date, status, schedule change details, and approval history

steps.action: Check that the PDF report is properly formatted with clear headers, readable text, and organized layout
steps.expectedResult: PDF report is well-formatted, professional-looking, with clear sections, proper alignment, and all data is readable

steps.action: Verify that the PDF includes report metadata such as generation date, scheduler name, and filter criteria applied
steps.expectedResult: PDF header or footer shows report generation timestamp, scheduler information, and applied filters

postconditions: Filtered request list is displayed accurately based on applied criteria
PDF report is successfully generated and downloaded
Original request data remains unchanged in the system
Filters can be cleared or modified for subsequent searches
Downloaded PDF file is saved to the user's device

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to audit all schedule change approval activities to ensure compliance and traceability

testCases.title: Validate completeness and accuracy of audit logs
preconditions: Administrator account with audit access permissions is available
System is operational and audit logging is enabled
At least one schedule change request exists in the system
Test user accounts with approval permissions are configured
Database connection to AuditLogs table is active

steps.action: Log into the system as a user with approval permissions
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to a pending schedule change request and approve it with comment 'Approved for testing purposes'
steps.expectedResult: Request is approved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to another schedule change request and reject it with comment 'Rejected due to resource constraints'
steps.expectedResult: Request is rejected successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to a third schedule change request and escalate it with comment 'Escalating to senior management'
steps.expectedResult: Request is escalated successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Log out from the approval user account and log in as System Administrator
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs into the audit portal

steps.action: Navigate to the audit logs section and retrieve logs for the actions performed in steps 2-4
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs are displayed showing all three actions (approval, rejection, escalation)

steps.action: Verify the approval action log entry contains user identity, timestamp, action type, and comment 'Approved for testing purposes'
steps.expectedResult: Log entry displays correct user identity, accurate timestamp, action type as 'APPROVED', and the exact comment text

steps.action: Verify the rejection action log entry contains user identity, timestamp, action type, and comment 'Rejected due to resource constraints'
steps.expectedResult: Log entry displays correct user identity, accurate timestamp, action type as 'REJECTED', and the exact comment text

steps.action: Verify the escalation action log entry contains user identity, timestamp, action type, and comment 'Escalating to senior management'
steps.expectedResult: Log entry displays correct user identity, accurate timestamp, action type as 'ESCALATED', and the exact comment text

steps.action: Verify all timestamps are accurate and match the time when actions were performed (within acceptable system time variance)
steps.expectedResult: All timestamps are accurate and reflect the actual time of action execution

postconditions: All approval workflow actions are logged in AuditLogs table
Audit logs contain complete and accurate information
System remains in stable state
Test data is available for subsequent test cases

testCases.title: Validate access control to audit logs
preconditions: System is operational with audit logging enabled
Non-administrator user account exists (regular user or approver without admin rights)
Administrator account with audit access exists
Access control policies are properly configured
Audit logs contain data from previous test execution

steps.action: Log into the system as a non-administrator user (regular user without admin privileges)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and standard user dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Attempt to navigate directly to the audit logs URL or menu option
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs menu option is not visible or navigation is blocked

steps.action: Attempt to access audit logs via direct URL entry (e.g., /audit/logs)
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with HTTP 403 Forbidden error or appropriate access denied message

steps.action: Verify the error message displayed indicates insufficient permissions
steps.expectedResult: Error message states 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view audit logs' or similar appropriate message

steps.action: Attempt to access audit logs API endpoint GET /audit/logs using non-administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error response indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out from non-administrator account and log in as System Administrator
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs into the audit portal with full access

steps.action: Navigate to audit logs section
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs are accessible and displayed successfully, confirming proper access control differentiation

steps.action: Verify that the failed access attempt by non-administrator is logged in the audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains entry showing unauthorized access attempt with user identity and timestamp

postconditions: Access control policies remain enforced
Unauthorized access attempt is logged
System security is maintained
No audit data was exposed to unauthorized users

testCases.title: Validate export functionality of audit logs
preconditions: Administrator account with audit access and export permissions is available
System is operational and audit logs contain test data
At least 5-10 audit log entries exist from previous test executions
Export functionality is enabled in the system
Browser allows file downloads
CSV and PDF export libraries are properly configured

steps.action: Log into the system as System Administrator
steps.expectedResult: Administrator successfully logs into the audit portal

steps.action: Navigate to the audit logs section
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs page is displayed with list of audit entries

steps.action: Apply filter to select audit logs for a specific date range (e.g., last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs are filtered and display only entries within the specified date range

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export' button or menu option
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu is displayed showing CSV and PDF format options

steps.action: Select 'Export as CSV' option
steps.expectedResult: CSV file download is initiated and file is saved to downloads folder

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using spreadsheet application (Excel, Google Sheets, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and displays audit log data in tabular format

steps.action: Verify CSV file contains all required columns: User Identity, Timestamp, Action Type, Request ID, Comments, and IP Address
steps.expectedResult: All required columns are present with proper headers

steps.action: Verify CSV file contains all filtered audit log entries with accurate data matching the portal display
steps.expectedResult: All audit entries from the filtered view are present in CSV with correct data values

steps.action: Return to audit logs page and click 'Export' button again, then select 'Export as PDF' option
steps.expectedResult: PDF file download is initiated and file is saved to downloads folder

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully and displays audit log data in formatted report layout

steps.action: Verify PDF file contains report header with title 'Audit Log Report', date range, and generation timestamp
steps.expectedResult: PDF header displays proper report title, filter criteria, and generation timestamp

steps.action: Verify PDF file contains all filtered audit log entries with all required fields in readable format
steps.expectedResult: All audit entries are present in PDF with proper formatting, columns are aligned, and data is complete and readable

steps.action: Compare data between CSV and PDF exports to ensure consistency
steps.expectedResult: Both CSV and PDF files contain identical audit log data with same number of entries and matching values

steps.action: Verify file names include timestamp or date identifier (e.g., audit_logs_2024-01-15.csv)
steps.expectedResult: Both exported files have descriptive names with date/timestamp identifiers for easy identification

postconditions: CSV and PDF files are successfully generated and downloaded
Exported files contain accurate and complete audit log data
Export action is logged in the audit trail
Downloaded files are available in the designated download location
System remains in stable state ready for next operation
